details.purpose: Zur Dokumentation der mechanischen Herzfrequenz, Herzrhythmus und Charakteristik des Pulses.
details.use: Zur Dokumentation der mechanischen Herzfrequenz ermittelt durch Abtasten oder ein geeignetes Gerät.
details.misuse: Nicht zur Dokumentation des periphären Pulses.

details.purpose: To record the mechanical rate, rhythm and character of the pulse as evidence of 'out-put' heart rate.
details.use: For recording mechanical rate of the heart as determined by palpation or suitable device.

items.items: Mehr als zwei ausgelassene Schläge pro Minute
*The number of missed beats per minute(en)
Die Körperstelle, an der der Puls gemessen wurde.
*Difference between the rate at the heart apex and a peripheral pulse.(en)
*Shape of the pulse wave on palpation(en)
Allorhythmie mit Aktions-Dreiergruppen (2 Sinusschläge u. 1 Extrasystole oder umgekehrt)
Weniger als zwei verpasste Schläge pro Minute
*The characteristics of the heart rate and rhythm.(en)
Die mechanische Herzfrequenz - üblicherweise durch Abtastung gemessen
*The rate of the heart in beats per minute.(en)
Unregulär in einer chaotischen Art und Weise
*Comment about the heart rate and rhythm.(en)
Die Position des Patienten während der Messung der Herzfrequenz
Auf dem Bett oder einem Stuhl sitzend
Person sitzt im 45° Winkel mit erhöhten Beinen
*The heart rate is present (implied true if rate >0).(en)
*The heart rate is present (implied true if rate >0).(en)
*Details about the device used to measure heart rate and rhythm.(en)
*Details about the method or machine used to record the heart rate and rhythm.(en)
*Details about physical exertion being undertaken at the time of recording heart rate and/or rhythm.(en)
*Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the heart rate and rhythm measurement. For example, level of anxiety; pain or fever etc.(en)
*Source of heart rate and rhythm record.(en)
*Derived from the electrical activity of the heart, commonly via an electrocardiograph.(en)
Missed beats of greater than 2 per minute
The number of missed beats per minute
The body site where the pulse was measured
Difference between the rate at the heart apex and a peripheral pulse.
Shape of the pulse wave on palpation
The apex beat of the heart (left 5th intercostal space, mid-clavicular line)
The carotid artery in the neck
Missed beats less than 2 per minute
The characteristics of the heart rate and rhythm.
The mechanical heart rate - usually measured by palpation
The rate of the heart in beats per minute.
The observed rhythm of the heartbeat.
Heart rhythm is irregular in a chaotic manner.
Comment about the heart rate and rhythm.
The position of the patient when the heartbeat was recorded.
Person reclining at 45 degrees with legs raised.
The heart rate is present (implied true if rate >0).
The heart rate is present (implied true if rate >0).
Details about the device used to measure heart rate and rhythm.
Details about the method or machine used to record the heart rate and rhythm.
Details about physical exertion being undertaken at the time of recording heart rate and/or rhythm.
Comment on and record other incidental factors that may be contributing to the heart rate and rhythm measurement. For example, level of anxiety; pain or fever etc.
Source of heart rate and rhythm record.
Derived from the electrical activity of the heart, commonly via an electrocardiograph.
